contents: Article 7 (Board of Directors) ① The Foundation shall have a board of directors consisting of the chairman, executive directors, and non-executive directors. ② The board of directors deliberates and decides on the following matters. Revised 2013. 10. 4., 2014. 6. 11., 2015. 7. 20., 2019. 7. 11., 2020. 11. 5., 1. Management goals, budget, operating plan and mid- to long-term financial management plan , 2. Use of reserve funds and carryover of budget, 3. Settlement of foundation accounting, 4. Acquisition and disposal of basic assets, 5. Borrowing of long-term loans and issuance of bonds and their repayment plan, 6. Disposal of surplus, 7. Investment/contribution to other businesses, etc., 8. Debt guarantees to other businesses, etc., excluding debt guarantees based on performance of guarantee work under the Act on the Establishment of the Korea Scholarship Foundation (hereinafter referred to as the *Foundation Act), 9. Changes to the Articles of Incorporation, 10. Enactment, revision and abolition of regulations, 11. Compensation of executives, 12. Matters related to write-off of compensation claims or student loan claims, 12-2. Matters related to the sale of indemnification claims, etc. pursuant to Article 49-8 of the Foundation Act, 13. Matters for which the Board of Directors considers deliberation and resolution as deemed necessary by the Chairman, 14. Other matters deemed particularly necessary by the Board of Directors, ③ The Chairman The following matters must be reported to the board of directors. Revised 2020. 11. 5., 2021. 12. 23. 1. Matters pointed out in the government audit, accounting audit, and audit by the Board of Audit and Inspection, and the corresponding action plan and performance; 2. Results of the foundation's collective agreement and the resulting budgetary estimate ( (limited to cases where a collective agreement has been concluded), 3. Other matters required by the board of directors to be reported to the chairman
